014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Optional;
019import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
020import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.interceptor.JdbiInterceptionChainHolder;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.JdbiOptionals;
027import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.internal.PojoMapperFactory;
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.Query;
029import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Alpha;
030
031/**
032 * Configuration registry for {@link RowMapperFactory} instances.
033 */
034public class RowMappers implements JdbiConfig<RowMappers> {
035
036    private final JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<RowMapper<?>, RowMapperFactory> inferenceInterceptors =
037        new JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<>(InferredRowMapperFactory::new);
038
039    private final List<RowMapperFactory> factories = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
040    private final ConcurrentHashMap<Type, Optional<RowMapper<?>>> cache = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
041
042    private ConfigRegistry registry;
043
044    public RowMappers() {
045        register(MapEntryMapper.factory());
046        register(new PojoMapperFactory());
047    }
048
049    private RowMappers(RowMappers that) {
050        factories.addAll(that.factories);
051        cache.putAll(that.cache);
052        inferenceInterceptors.copy(that.inferenceInterceptors);
053    }
054
055    @Override
056    public void setRegistry(ConfigRegistry registry) {
057        this.registry = registry;
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Returns the {@link JdbiInterceptionChainHolder} for the RowMapper inference. This chain allows registration of custom interceptors to change the standard type
062     * inference for the {@link RowMappers#register(RowMapper)} method.
063     */
064    @Alpha
065    public JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<RowMapper<?>, RowMapperFactory> getInferenceInterceptors() {
066        return inferenceInterceptors;
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Register a row mapper which will have its parameterized type inspected to determine what it maps to.
071     * Will be used with {@link Query#mapTo(Class)} for registered mappings.
072     * <p>
073     * The parameter must be concretely parameterized, we use the type argument T to
074     * determine if it applies to a given type.
075     * <p>
076     * {@link java.lang.Object} is not supported as a concrete parameter type.
077     *
078     * @param mapper the row mapper
079     * @return this
080     * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if the RowMapper is not a concretely parameterized type
081     */
082    public RowMappers register(RowMapper<?> mapper) {
083        RowMapperFactory factory = inferenceInterceptors.process(mapper);
084
085        return this.register(factory);
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Register a row mapper for a given type.
090     *
091     * @param <T> the type
092     * @param type the type to match with equals.
093     * @param mapper the row mapper
094     * @return this
095     */
096    public <T> RowMappers register(GenericType<T> type, RowMapper<T> mapper) {
097        return this.register(RowMapperFactory.of(type.getType(), mapper));
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Register a row mapper for a given type.
102     *
103     * @param type the type to match with equals.
104     * @param mapper the row mapper
105     * @return this
106     */
107    public RowMappers register(Type type, RowMapper<?> mapper) {
108        return this.register(RowMapperFactory.of(type, mapper));
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Register a row mapper factory.
113     * <p>
114     * Will be used with {@link Query#mapTo(Class)} for registered mappings.
115     *
116     * @param factory the row mapper factory
117     * @return this
118     */
119    public RowMappers register(RowMapperFactory factory) {
120        factories.add(0, factory);
121        cache.clear();
122        return this;
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Obtain a row mapper for the given type in the given context.
127     *
128     * @param <T> the type of the mapper to find
129     * @param type the target type to map to
130     * @return a RowMapper for the given type, or empty if no row mapper is registered for the given type.
131     */
132    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
133    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findFor(Class<T> type) {
134        RowMapper<T> mapper = (RowMapper<T>) findFor((Type) type).orElse(null);
135        return Optional.ofNullable(mapper);
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Obtain a row mapper for the given type in the given context.
140     *
141     * @param <T> the type of the mapper to find
142     * @param type the target type to map to
143     * @return a RowMapper for the given type, or empty if no row mapper is registered for the given type.
144     */
145    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
146    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findFor(GenericType<T> type) {
147        RowMapper<T> mapper = (RowMapper<T>) findFor(type.getType()).orElse(null);
148        return Optional.ofNullable(mapper);
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Obtain a row mapper for the given type in the given context.
153     *
154     * @param type the target type to map to
155     * @return a RowMapper for the given type, or empty if no row mapper is registered for the given type.
156     */
157    public Optional<RowMapper<?>> findFor(Type type) {
158        // ConcurrentHashMap can enter an infinite loop on nested computeIfAbsent calls.
159        // Since row mappers can decorate other row mappers, we have to populate the cache the old fashioned way.
160        // See https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8062841, https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8142175
161        Optional<RowMapper<?>> cached = cache.get(type);
162
163        if (cached != null) {
164            return cached;
165        }
166
167        Optional<RowMapper<?>> mapper = factories.stream()
168                .flatMap(factory -> JdbiOptionals.stream(factory.build(type, registry)))
169                .findFirst();
170
171        mapper.ifPresent(m -> m.init(registry));
172
173        cache.put(type, mapper);
174
175        return mapper;
176    }
177
178    @Override
179    public RowMappers createCopy() {
180        return new RowMappers(this);
181    }
182}
